      SkelLineString[] Skeletonizer.skeletonize(Polygon wb, com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point[] riverInOutPointsPoints)
      main entry prepare data - remove unnecessary riverInOutPoints - add extra riverInOutPoints if there are only 0 or 1 - remove polygon points that are <0.1m from a river entry point - translate to origin (for precision) - remove acute angled portions of the polygon at riverInOutPoints + add the translated riverInOutpoints - densify so vertex-vertex distance less than 50m for all vertices on a ring - number vertices of the polygon - run adaptive densify + at this point we have a "good polygon" and river entry points.
      SkelLineString[] Skeletonizer.skeletonizeMain(Polygon wb, com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] riverInOutPoints)
      1.
      SkelLineString[] Skeletonizer.trimExitEntryPoint(Polygon poly, SkelLineString[] inputSkelLines, Coordinate[] riverPoints)
      change any of the "keepMe" (exit/entry point edges) so its clipped to the node.
